intro: Eriocephala lenninghausii, commonly known as the Leninghaus's eriocephala, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
